LET’S FIND OUT
Science
Series VIII
Grades 1-2
Purpose
Foreword
"Let’s Find Out", a series of fourteen science broadcasts has been planned to
help young listeners (1) to accurately observe the things about them; (2) to enable
them to identify some common objects and to recognize a few characteristics of
these; (3) to provide opportunity to gain some skill in simple manipulation of
materials within their ability to investigate*
Equipment and Supplies Needed
Numerous items, not already on hand in some schools may be needed in carrying
out the experiments. Most of these can be secured through regular channels of the
school system, or can easily be gotten by the pupils from their homes.
Teachers are urgently requested to plan far enough ahead so that any materials
needed from the Supply Department or the Division of Audio-Visual Education can be
ordered and delivered in time for the broadcasts without departing from the usual
schedules for such delivery.
Content
The programs are arranged in units which follow as nearly as possible the
changes in seasons and which are correlated with the course of study for the primary
grades•
Preparation for Broadcasts
Preparations for each program should be made in advance so that the pupils,
individually, in groups, or by demonstration, will carry out the experiments as the
directions come to them over the air.
Use of the Broadcasts
We hope you will think of this series of science broadcasts as
to be used only if it can in any way enrich your science teaching,
about which we will welcome your critical comments if you listen to
the series.
